vehicles

Class Car

  • java.lang.Object
    • vehicles.Vehicle
      • vehicles.Car

  • public class Car
extends Vehicle
    This class is the base for a Helicopter object, which is a type of Vehicle.
    Version:
    Oct 26, 2025
    Author:
    Nick Stoyanov

      • Car

           double maxCapableSpeed,
           int acceleration,
           int weight,
           int enginePower,
           int tireGrip,
           int turnRate,
           int racePositionPercentage)
        Constructor for a Car object.
        Parameters:
        speed - base speed for car
        maxCapableSpeed - maximum capable speed of the car
        acceleration - acceleration of
        weight - weight of the car
        enginePower - engine power of the car
        tireGrip - tire grip of the car
        turnRate - turn rate of the car
        racePositionPercentage - current race percentage

        No argument constructor

    • Method Detail

      • getEnginePower

        public int getEnginePower()
        Accessor method to access the engine power of the car.
        Returns:
        car engine power

      • getTireGrip

        public int getTireGrip()
        Accessor method to access the grip of the tires of the car.
        Returns:
        car tire grip

      • getTurnRate

        public int getTurnRate()
        Accessor method to get the turn rate of the car.
        Returns:
        car turn rate

      • setEnginePower

        public void setEnginePower(int newEnginePower)
        Mutator method to set the engine power of the car. To ensure it's reasonable, it only accepts values between 50 to 400.
        Parameters:
        newEnginePower - new engine power to be set

      • setTireGrip

        public void setTireGrip(int newTireGrip)
        Mutator method to set the tire grip of the car. To ensure it's reasonable, it only accepts values between 1 to 10.
        Parameters:
        newTireGrip - new tire grip to be set

      • setTurnRate

        public void setTurnRate(int newTurnRate)
        Mutator method to set the turn rate of the car. To ensure it's reasonable, it only accepts values between 1 to 20.
        Parameters:
        newTurnRate - new turn rate to be set

      • calcSpeed

        public double calcSpeed(double speed,
                        int weight,
                        int acceleration)
        Method to calculate a hypothetical speed of a car while still considering the weight of itself. This method considers other car specific factors such as a vehicles engine power, and the grip of the tires.
        Specified by:
        calcSpeed in class Vehicle
        Parameters:
        speed - Vehicle Speed
        weight - Vehicle Weight
        acceleration - Vehicle Acceleration
        Returns:
        accurate speed of car

      • attemptTurn

        public boolean attemptTurn(int requiredTurnRadius)
        Method to attempt to turn the car based on a required turn radius.
        Parameters:
        requiredTurnRadius - required turn radius to successfully navigate
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • turboBoost

        public void turboBoost()
        Method to turbo boost the car, increasing its speed by 25% of its current speed. Turboing will reduce the car's engine power by 20 after each use.

      • weatherDebuff

        public void weatherDebuff()
        The weather debuff method simulates the effect of bad weather conditions on the car's tire grip. It reduces the tire grip by a random amount between 1 and whatever the original tire grip was, ensuring that the tire grip does not fall below 1.
        Specified by:
        weatherDebuff in class Vehicle

      • engineIssueDebuff

        public void engineIssueDebuff()
        Method to simulate a very rare chance of engine issues, reducing engine power by a random amount between 10 and 100. The engine power will not fall below 50.
